page.title: 07Fletton land reclamation 3
page.content: After the pit filling process has been completed, then effort is made to landscape the area. Later, various forms of plant life - trees, grasses and cereal crops are encouraged successfully to grow. Cattle have used the area for grazing and some cereals have been cropped. The whole area is a haven for wild life and every effort has been made to enable swans, geese, ducks and small mammals to inhabit the area. Certain pits have test buildings plced upon them to give guidelines as to the future possibilities of house building on the reclaimed pits. Already the southern section of the Peterborough ring road has been constructed for some 2 km across reclaimed pits.
